troskovice_chronicle_part_yZYo: <heading>The Brothers of the Commonwealth</heading><paragraph>Aleš and Míka, sons of the carpenter Marek, who had fallen down in age last winter, certainly did not take after their father. Ever since their uncle Josef came from Mladějov to take over their upbringing, both of them began to shun people, and various rumours began to circulate among the good people of Troskovice about how the brothers were always gloomy and did not like to stay alone with their uncle. Res etiam graviores malae factae sunt - then the brothers left their native land. But uncle Joseph forbade the brothers to look for them, and began to tell various stories about their idleness. Ambo fratres magna peccata habebant - they were said to have wanted to have devilish intercourse with their uncle. Joseph took the cottage as his own, but he still cannot manage the land formerly belonging to his brothers. For it was the younger Ales who had their borders in mind, for he had once been cut on them. This story should therefore be a warning to future generations that a new way of marking boundaries must be created.</paragraph><newpage/>

Ever since their uncle Josef came from Mladějov to take over their upbringing, both of them began to shun people, and various rumours began to circulate among the good people of Troskovice about how the brothers were always gloomy and did not like to stay alone with their uncle. Res etiam graviores malae factae sunt - then the brothers left their native land. But uncle Joseph forbade the brothers to look for them, and began to tell various stories about their idleness. Ambo fratres magna peccata habebant - they were said to have wanted to have devilish intercourse with their uncle. Joseph took the cottage as his own, but he still cannot manage the land formerly belonging to his brothers. For it was the younger Ales who had their borders in mind, for he had once been cut on them. This story should therefore be a warning to future generations that a new way of marking boundaries must be created.</paragraph><newpage/>

ui_in_handgonne: A pistole is a firearm that uses gunpowder to shoot small pieces of metal or stone. A thick metal barrel with a handle is attached to a wooden stock, similar to a spear, for example. Fire through the powder stopper detonates the main charge in the barrel and shoots the projectile out. It is fired by a lit cord, a red-hot iron wire or, at worst, a burning wood. This pistole has a barrel forged from iron and is therefore less durable than those cast from bronze. If you hit anything alive with this weapon, it will definitely die.

A handgonne is a firearm that uses gunpowder to shoot small pieces of metal or stone. A thick metal barrel with a handle is attached to a wooden stock, similar to a spear, for example. Fire through the powder stopper detonates the main charge in the barrel and shoots the projectile out. It is fired by a lit cord, a red-hot iron wire or in a worst case scenario, a burning stick. The barrel is fitted with a hook on the underside, which serves to wedge the weapon behind an obstacle and limit recoil when fired. ui_in_lambMeatCooked: This cooked lamb is melting on your tongue.

ui_in_lambStomach: This may not be the most popular meal ever, but what can you do. The best way to prepare it is to fill it with whatever you like or have on hand, sew it up and then boil it for a long time. A dish prepared in this way is very compact and portable and therefore suitable for travelling.

A distant relative of garlic. It whets the appetite and is a garnish to any vegetable soup.
ui_in_legs_brigandine01: Protection of the entire leg formed by individual iron plates riveted to the honest cowhide leather. This is an older form of folded armour, which can be seen especially in the shape of the knee pads.

ui_in_legs_brigandine03: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

ui_in_legs_brigandine04: Full leg protection, consisting of laminar and plate armour, made with an emphasis on lighter weight, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

ui_in_legs_padded01: Simple quilted hose. Not exactly the pinnacle of a tailoring skill. They can be used alone or as a softened underlayer to another and better armour.

ui_in_legs_padded02: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armor.

ui_in_legs_padded02_vagrant: Comfortable even while running and sneaking around, both of which are a daily occurrence for a vagrant.
Comfortable even while running and sneaking around, both of which are a daily occurrence for a vagrant.
ui_in_legs_padded03: Thick wool trousers, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.
Thick wool trousers, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.
ui_in_legs_padded05: Thigh-length boots that protect the horseman's legs against chaffing. Putting them on and taking them off is a rather lengthy process, so they're worn more by folks who tend to spend the whole day in the saddle, such as messengers and grooms.

ui_in_legspadded_godwin: Quilted trousers that have seen the world. They are comfortably worn and freshly repaired so they can keep on serving.
Padded leggings that have seen the world. They are comfortably broken-in and freshly repaired so they can keep on serving their purpose.
ui_in_legs_plate01: A leg protection consisting of forged plates of sheet metal suitably fit together. Such armour protects the warrior's entire leg, but its weight depends on the craftsmanship of the maker.
A leg protection consisting of forged plates of sheet metal suitably fit together. Such armour protects the warrior's entire leg, but its weight depends on the craftsmanship of the maker.
ui_in_legs_plate02: Leg protection consisting of forged pieces of sheet metal. The front consists of plates equipped with a dorsal edge, so the armour is harder to cut through and even under the force of a crushing blow it will not simply sag.
Leg protection consisting of forged pieces of sheet metal. The front consists of plates equipped with a dorsal edge, so the armour is harder to cut through and will even endure a crushing blow.
ui_in_legs_plate03: A masterpiece of plate armour decorated with brass lining. The forged plates are further hardened to achieve higher durability, while the metal sheet could be weaker and therefore lighter overall. The plate legs are completed with foot protection called sabatons.

A masterpiece of plate armour decorated with brass lining. The forged plates are further hardened to achieve higher durability, while the metal sheet could be weaker and therefore lighter overall. The plate legs are completed with foot protection called sabatons.
ui_in_legs_plate04: Only partial leg protection. This armour only protects the thighs and knees of a fighter who, for some reason, wants to save weight or the cost of the armor. But one should think twice if this is a good idea.
Partial leg protection, coverinng only the thighs and knees of its wearer who, for some reason, decided to save on armour cost. One should think twice whether this is a good idea, though.
ui_in_legs_plate05: A leg protection made from tempered sheet metal plates forged into the dorsal edge to better withstand slashing and crushing blows. The armor is not fitted with sabatons, as its intended wearer is not a horserider and often must move on foot.

ui_in_legs_plate06: Simple knee pads that can be part of full armour. They are most often worn separately by those who cannot afford more expensive armour or who would be unnecessarily restricted in their movement by it.

ui_in_longsword: A longsword for swordmasters is a noble and damn dangerous weapon. Like the tongue of a viper, it can cut the thread of life in an instant. This blade is designed primarily for tournaments, but in a more fierce battle it could quickly come to naught.

ui_in_longswordBroad: A perfectly balanced longsword with a wide blade is the golden mean. What it loses in speed it makes up for in durability.
A perfectly balanced long sword with a wide blade is the gold standard. What it lacks in speed it makes up for in durability.
ui_in_longswordCommon: The longsword is a perfectly balanced lethal weapon. Its price is not small, because only a master of his craft can forge a thin yet flexible blade! The longsword is not meant for the heat of battle, but for swift swordplay.

ui_in_longswordDemo: The long sword is a fearsome weapon commonly used by knights and warriors in 15th century Europe. With a blade measuring over 3 feet in length, it is designed for powerful strikes and precise thrusts, making it versatile in both one-on-one combat and battlefield skirmishes. Its sturdy construction and balanced weight allow for swift movements and devastating blows, making it a popular choice for those seeking to dominate their opponents in close combat.

ui_in_longswordDuel: A perfectly balanced sword with a slender blade for true sword masters. The longsword is a noble weapon for swordfighting and a quick way to send any fool to the other side.

ui_in_pigLiver: Raw pork liver should be eaten for some diseases, but otherwise it is better to cook it.
Raw pork liver should be eaten for some diseases, but otherwise it is better to cook it.
ui_in_pigLiverCooked: Fatty pork liver, a delicacy of courts and backyards. But it should be prepared first. Perhaps by frying them with onions in butter, then pouring black beer over them and adding pieces of bread.
Fatty pork liver, a delicacy of courts and backyards. But it should be prepared first. Perhaps by frying them with onions in butter, then pouring black beer over them and adding pieces of bread.
ui_in_pigMeat: Raw pork should be prepared in many ways. But always beware of burning or frying it!
There are many ways to prepare pork. Just be careful not to burn it or undercook it!
ui_in_pigMeatCooked: You can make a delicious cake out of pork. Salt the meat and boil it until tender. Slice apples, add eggs and pepper, add to the meat and continue cooking. Mix the flour with the wine, add the eggs and cream, put a little saffron on top, and knead a good dough. Place the meat on top, cover with the pastry and then bake until golden brown.

You can make a delicious pastry with pork. Salt the meat and boil it until tender. Slice apples, add eggs and pepper, add to the meat and continue cooking. Mix the flour with the wine, add the eggs and cream, put a little saffron on top, and knead a good dough. Place the meat on top, cover with the pastry and then bake until golden brown.
ui_in_pigMeatDried: Dried pig is excellent for long trips to the mountains...
Dried pig is excellent for long trips to the mountains...
ui_in_pigMeatSmoked: Smoked pig tastes best on plum wood.
Smoked pig tastes best on plum wood.
ui_in_pigTenderloin: Here is a Hungarian way of cooking pork. Pound the meat, put it in water and let it rest overnight. Take it out of water, salt it and sear it. Fry plenty of onion, add wine, vinegar, juniper, caraway, cloves, pepper, ginger and a little nutmeg too. Bring everything to boil, add the meat, keep the lid on and cook over a low heat for a long time, while basting with wine.

Here is a Hungarian way of cooking pork. Pound the meat, put it in water and let it rest overnight. Take it out of water, salt it and sear it. Fry plenty of onion, add wine, vinegar, juniper, caraway, cloves, pepper, ginger and a little nutmeg too. Bring everything to boil, add the meat, keep the lid on and cook over a low heat for a long time, while basting with wine.
ui_in_placeholder_weapon: Placeholder weapon, if you found it in the final build, report it!
Placeholder weapon, if you found it in the final build, report it!
ui_in_player_lockpick: A tool to pick locks, just do it carefully.
A tool used for picking locks. Just don't get caught doing it.
ui_in_player_shovel: Graves are dug with a spade, sand is thrown with a shovel.
Spades are for digging graves, shovels are for tossing sand.
ui_in_player_shovel_wolfram: This spade is like a gift from heaven. Its blade is so sharp it could split the clouds. When you hold it in your hand, you feel as if it wants to speak through you. The tiny cuts on it are like the gentle strokes of the angels themselves. On its blade, you can not only make out the soil, but also traces of clay, calcium, and coal left behind by the years of service. With a spade like this, you wouldn't even hesitate to go to war against the local invaders.

This spade is like a gift from the heavens. Its blade is so sharp, it could split the clouds. When you firmly grasp it in your hand, you feel as if it wants to speak through you. The subtle cuts and scrapes on it are like the graceful strokes of the angels themselves. On its blade, you can make out not only soil, but also traces of clay, calcium, and charcoal left behind by its many years of service. With a spade like this, you wouldn't even hesitate going up against the local invaders.
ui_in_plums: Delicious fruit with fragrant flesh. Watch out for the sharp pit inside!
Delicious fruit with fragrant flesh. Watch out for the sharp pit inside!
ui_in_podMostem_tunic: A dark faded tunic. Once dressed, the wearer becomes invisible... but more likely, no one will want to look at him.

ui_in_polearmBardiche: A simple polearm weapon for those who need to keep the enemy and the urban scum at bay. The original blade is joined with a hook for tripping legs or pushing ladders off walls.
A simple pole weapon for those who need to keep the enemy and the cities' scum at bay. Its original blade is joined with a hook for tripping enemies' legs and pushing ladders off battlements.
ui_in_polearmBruncvik: A knight's battle axe on a staff. This is exactly what George the Lion of Wartenberg wanted. In the end, I made it according to the lost instructions.
A knight's battle axe on a staff. This is exactly what George the Lion of Wartenberg wanted. In the end, I made it according to the lost instructions.
ui_in_polearmGlaive: A simple polearm weapon for those who are not so noble as to get their hands on something better. It's nothing more than a long blade with a sharp point on a long handle, but unlike other pikes it doesn't have a hook.

A simple pole weapon for those who aren't highborn enough to get their hands on something better. It's nothing more than a long blade with a sharp point on a long handle, but unlike other pikes it doesn't have a hook.
ui_in_polearmGuisarme: An excellent long weapon for infantry and anyone who prefers to keep their opponent at bay. The secret of its true power is hidden in the tight formation of the trained men who, with its help, can resist even a charge of knightly cavalry.

An excellent long weapon for infantry and anyone who prefers to keep their opponent at bay. The secret of its true power is hidden in the tight formation of the trained men who, with its help, can resist even a charge of knightly cavalry.
ui_in_polearmMorgenstern: A crushing polearm weapon whose name may refer to the first morning star, but for the enemy, a blow from its blade is likely to be the last thing they will ever see. A seemingly clumsy weapon that can command respect in any brawl.

A crushing polearm weapon whose name may refer to the first morning star, but for the enemy, a blow from its blade is likely to be the last thing they will ever see. A seemingly clumsy weapon that can command respect in any brawl.
ui_in_polearmpitchfork: If nothing better is at hand, at least this will do. A simple but effective tool, which is as good for pitching hay as it is at stabbing the enemy where the sun don't shine.
If nothing better is at hand, at least this will do. A simple but effective tool, which is as good for pitching hay as it is at stabbing the enemy where the sun don't shine.
ui_in_polearmpitchforkSedlakaMateje: A pitchfork left here by famer Matthew. Everyone in Tachov knows that wherever Matthew and his pitchfork go, merriment follows. It seems Matthew may have gotten a bit too merry, as he left his pitchfork behind.

A pitchfork left here by farmer Matthew. Everyone in Tachov knows that wherever Matthew and his pitchfork go, merriment follows. It seems Matthew may have gotten a bit too merry, as he left his pitchfork behind.
ui_in_polearmpoleaxe: A knight's battle axe on a pole designed especially for noble warriors, because its forging cannot be entrusted to any village blacksmith. A terrible crushing and slashing weapon, it can cut through even the best armour like a knife through butter.

A knight's battle axe on a pole designed especially for noble warriors, because its forging cannot be entrusted to any village blacksmith. A terrible crushing and slashing weapon, it can cut through even the best armour like a knife through butter.
ui_in_polearmSpear: An immortal weapon well known to mankind since the creation of the world. A simple long spear with a hook for tripping legs of enemies or throwing ladders off walls.
An immortal weapon well known to mankind since the creation of the world. A simple long spear with an added hook for tripping the legs of enemies and pushing ladders off battlements.
ui_in_polearmTraining: A wooden pole without reinforced ends, so it wouldn't hurt so much during infantry training. It can also be used at any time to prove that there are no small men only small targets.
A wooden pole without reinforced ends, so it wouldn't hurt so much during infantry training. It can also be used at any time to prove that there are no small men only small targets.
ui_in_polearmvoulge: The most common infantry Polearm weapon. A virtuous knight would not touch such a weapon, but for a city patrol it is an invaluable tool for establishing order and respect in even the most filthy places.

A polearm commonly used by foot soldiers. A virtuous knight would not touch such a weapon, but for a city patrol it is an invaluable tool for establishing order and respect in even the most crime-ridden places.
ui_in_pomatenec_brokenSword: The broken sword I got from the aggressive madman near the place where painter Vojta sent me. It might be worth getting it repaired for him.
The broken sword I got from the aggressive madman near the place where painter Voyta sent me. It might be worth getting it repaired for him.
ui_in_pomatenec_longsword: Meč starého blázna ze zemnice, ke které mě poslal malíř Vojtěch. Na čepeli je vyryto: Confiteor Deo omnipotenti.
ui_in_poppyseedcake: A good poppy seed cake is beneficial to all the senses. It calms and soothes. Quick, one more piece before it's banned for its very goodness!
A good poppy seed cake is beneficial to all the senses. It calms and soothes. Quick, one more piece before it's banned for being too delicious!

ui_in_rabbitLiver: The offal and entrails are all healthy, and among them the heart most of all. You can fry or boil them or add them to soups. The main thing is to use everything and not waste anything.

It might look awful, but offal and entrails are all healthy, the heart most of all. You can fry or boil them or add them to soups. The main thing is to use everything and not waste any of the carcass.
ui_in_rabbitMeat: Hare meat is very good, healthy and tender. It's a welcome addition to the diet of many villagers. You can prepare it with onions by taking the whole hare and putting it in a baking dish. Salt it and pour some butter under it. Once roasted, cut it into pieces, put it in some beer and continue to cook with a little vinegar. Meanwhile, fry some onion in fat until golden brown. Then add it to the sauce, thicken with breadcrumbs or flour and cook until done. You can season it with any spice you have.

Hare meat is very good, healthy and tender. It's a welcome addition to the diet of many villagers. You can prepare it with onions by taking the whole hare and putting it in a baking dish. ui_in_taboryUcesty_ostatkyKostSvaty: A tiny fragment of bone, which is said to have come from the hand of St. Maurice, is certainly a very precious holy relic. In ancient times, Saint Maurice was the commander of a Roman legion  that was decimated by the Emperor for refusing to sacrifice to pagan gods before battle. The martyr is the patron saint of soldiers, weavers, armourers and the protector of vine. This bone may indeed be genuine, as the entire arm was once brought back by the Czech King Vladislav II and later distributed to many Czech churches.

ui_in_taboryUcesty_ostatkylebkaSvaty: A small fragment of flat bone is said to have come from the skull of Saint Margaret. In ancient times, the Roman Emperor persecuted all Christians and had many cruelly martyred. Margaret was denounced by her disgraced suitor to a prefect for secretly professing faith in Christ. In prison, the devil himself appeared to the good virgin and devoured her in the form of a dragon, but she triumphed over him with the help of the cross. She even survived drowning and burning by fire, so that eventually she had to be beheaded. It is said that the Czech King Přemysl Otakar once received a few relics of this martyr from the Pope himself after his victory over the Hungarians.

A small fragment of flat bone said to come from the skull of Saint Margaret. In ancient times, the Roman Emperor persecuted all Christians and had many of them cruelly martyred. Margaret was reported by her spurned suitor to the prefect, accusing her of secretly professing faith in Christ. In prison, the devil himself appeared to the virtuous maiden in the form of a dragon and devoured her, but she overcame him with the help of the cross. She survived drowning and burning by fire, so they finally had to behead her. A few relics of this martyr were supposedly given to the Czech King Premysl Otakar by the Pope himself after his victory over the Hungarians.
ui_in_taboryUcesty_ostatkyNehetSvaty: A tiny fragment of St Catherine's fingernail wrapped in embroidered linen. Princess Catherine of Egypt was martyred by the Roman Emperor for her unwavering faith in Christ. It was a terrible torture. The martyr was tied between two spiked wheels and torn alive. But God intervened and destroyed the hideous machine, and Catherine had to be beheaded with the sword. The pious Emperor Charles IV enforced the feast of this martyr in the Bohemian kingdom because he believed she had helped him turn the hopeless course of the Battle of San Felice into a glorious victory.

ui_in_taboryUcesty_ostatkyOdevSvaty: A tiny fragment from the veil of Saint Ludmila is a piece of very fine batiste. Ludmila prayed sincerely to Christ and brought her grandson, Prince Wenceslas, the patron saint of the Bohemian Kingdom, to faith. But she stood in the way of her power-hungry daughter-in-law Drahomira, who sent two cruel Norsemen to kill her. It is said, they have done it with her own veil while the duchess was praying to God.

ui_in_taboryUcesty_ostatkyVlasySvaty: A few strands of hair are said to have belonged to Saint Barbara, who was cruelly punished by her pagan father for accepting faith in Christ. Fleeing from him, she hid in a rock crevice and therefore became the patron saint of all the miners. But a certain shepherd revealed her hiding place to the executioners and the virgin was captured and cruelly tortured into renouncing her faith. Finally, scourged and with her breasts cut off, she was led naked to the execution place, where she was beheaded by her own father.

These few strands of hair are said to have belonged to Saint Barbara, who was cruelly punished by her pagan father for accepting faith in Christ. As she fled from him, she hid in a rock crevice, which is why today she is the patron saint of all miners. Only a certain shepherd revealed her hiding place to her pursuers, and the young maiden was captured and cruelly tortured into renouncing her faith. Finally, after she was whipped and her breasts were cut off, she was led naked to the execution block where she was beheaded by her own father.

utoknebakov_admirerletter_XTO9:
When you're picking roses, be careful,
♪ don't get hurt ♪ your bold action. Feel the flower and sing to it in secret,
♪ caress the words till your breath is melted. For what dead things have slept before,
In the heat of your heart, it will bloom with a boisterous blossom.

When you pick a rose, take care,
that this bold action that you dare
does not bring a wound to bear. Care for the flower and sing to it secretly,
with words of love that caress so sweetly. That a now dead thing once slept unmoving
In the warmth of your heart is brightly blooming.

utoknebakov_poetryprokopf_OfJh:
My good friend, perhaps a few of my verses will please you as much as they pleased me when I wrote them with a poor quill and weak ink in captivity in Presburg, Hungary.Little tit, thou fearest nothing,
that dread birds of prey pursue thee.
Singing sweetly is your sole pleasure.I would guard thee, pretty bird,
no cage I'd have, but freedom with thee.
We'd fly beyond the Danube, over the northern forests,
my heart would beat for you alone.He who has no freedom, neither can he give it,
but only sing that once again, the earth shall turn green in the spring.
To no one by debt and none by command, only to the smiles of girls does my heart confess.

utoknebakov_poetryvagabon_23no:
If a boy and girl should happen to
come together in a room,
happy is their coupling. Amor rises higher,
between the happy couple
by shame they are not troubled,
an ineffable game begins
'twixt their lips, their arms, their limbs.

If a boy and girl should happen to
come together in a room,
How happy is that couple! Then the glow of Amor rises, rises double!
When they lie in bed,
by shame they are not troubled,
'Tis then a game begins
'twixt their lips, their arms, their limbs.

Veni, veni, venias,
ne me mori facias,
hyrca, hyrca, nazaza,
trillirivos! Pulchra tibi facies,
oculorum acies,
capillorum series,
o quam clara species! Rosa rubicundior,
lilio candidior,
omnibus formosior,
semper in te glorior!

utoknebakov_poetryvagabon_SJmj:
Come now, come now, come to me,
leave me not to die, I pray.
Hyrca, hyrca, nazaza,
trillirivos! Beautiful your pretty face,
Radiant your lovely gaze,
Your hair in tresses all arranged,
How your appearance does amaze! Rosier than theRose are you,
whiter than the lily too,
fairer than all other girls,
for me forever glorious!

utoknebakov_undoneletterf_bC5T:
Behold the dance, the body's joy,
passionate and glittering. What the tongue cannot achieve,
courageous steps may bring. The dance, I say, is life itself,
easy, hard or sometimes gentle.
And little serves or tolerates
the old, the pious and the sensible.

vezninatroskach_bergovboo_B3BV: <heading>March 14th</heading><paragraph>I stand alone on a hill with fallen knights lying around me. A storm is coming. The ravens are coming. One of them sits on my sword stuck in the ground. I try to get to it, but I can't take a step. I fall to my knees. And then it's dark.</paragraph>

<heading>March 14th</heading><paragraph>I stand alone on a hill with fallen knights lying around me. A storm is coming. The ravens are coming. One of them sits on my sword stuck in the ground. I try to get to it, but I can't take a step. I fall to my knees. And then it's dark.</paragraph><newpage/>
vezninatroskach_bergovboo_DmjM: <title>Diary of Dreams</title><subtitle>to Otto from Henry of Rosenberg</subtitle><newpage/>
vezninatroskach_bergovboo_Nlhu: <heading>May 10</heading><paragraph>The dream with the crown comes back to me again. I haven't dreamt anything else for three nights now. Nothing helps.</paragraph><newpage/>
<heading>May 10th</heading><paragraph>The dream with the crown comes back to me again. I haven't dreamt anything else for three nights now. Nothing helps.</paragraph><newpage/>
vezninatroskach_bergovboo_QwM9: <heading>5. května</heading><paragraph>I walk around the Ruins while a great banquet is going on in the great hall. Dozens of nobles and noble ladies. Many of them are now dead, but in my dream they sit drinking wine and rejoicing with the living.</paragraph><paragraph>Suddenly time stops. They all freeze like stone statues. The wine being poured stops in mid-air. The only thing that moves is me. I should be confused, maybe even scared, but I'm not. I feel like I can do anything.</paragraph><paragraph>I walk among the nobles and noble ladies. I take whatever I want. I touch whatever I want... I know they'll never come out of their stupor.</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>May 5th</heading><paragraph>I walk around Trosky while a great banquet is going on in the great hall. Dozens of nobles and noble ladies. Many of them are now dead, but in my dream they sit drinking wine and rejoicing with the living.</paragraph><paragraph>Suddenly time stops. They all freeze like stone statues. The wine being poured stops in mid-air. The only thing that moves is me. I should be confused, maybe even scared, but I'm not. I feel like I can do anything.</paragraph><paragraph>I walk among the nobles and noble ladies. I take whatever I want. I touch whatever I want... I know they'll never come out of their stupor.</paragraph><newpage/>
vezninatroskach_bergovboo_ReYY: <heading>26. května</heading><paragraph>I'm standing in front of a huge mirror, looking at my wrinkles. I see how I've aged. Every redness of my skin. I see every hair that falls out...</paragraph><paragraph>But suddenly the reflection changes. The mirror ripples like the surface of water and I see myself in it young and vibrant again. I can't believe it. I look around. I strip naked, trying to find something to destroy the illusion of youth, but it's perfect. Not a wrinkle anywhere.</paragraph><paragraph>I can't hold the look. I'm filled with rage. I lunge for my reflection. My hands pass through the mirror and tighten around my young neck. I cringe, but my young self doesn't notice. Instead, I lose my own breath until I finally fall to the floor.</paragraph><newpage/><newpage/><newpage/><newpage/>

<heading>May 26th</heading><paragraph>I'm standing in front of a huge mirror, looking at my wrinkles. I see how I've aged. Every redness of my skin. I feel every hair that falls out...</paragraph><paragraph>But suddenly the reflection changes. The mirror ripples like the surface of water and I see myself in it young and vibrant again. I can't believe it. I look around. I strip naked, trying to find something to destroy the illusion of youth, but it's perfect. Not a wrinkle anywhere.</paragraph><paragraph>I can't stand the view. I'm filled with rage. I lunge for my reflection. My hands pass through the mirror and tighten around my young neck. I'm choking, but my young self doesn't notice. Instead, I lose my own breath until I finally fall to the floor.</paragraph><newpage/><newpage/><newpage/><newpage/>
vezninatroskach_bergovboo_tEUk: <heading>17. března</heading><paragraph>I'm walking down a dark corridor. Somewhere in the distance ahead of me, something shimmers. I don't know what it is, but I feel I must reach it. I'm getting closer. Closer and closer, until I can vaguely make out what I'm looking at...</paragraph><paragraph>The St. Nicholas Crown! It's so beautiful. And so close... I could reach it...</paragraph><paragraph>I'm not going, I'm running. I reach out my hand. I can already feel the golden coolness of the crown with my fingertips. But suddenly a fox leaps in front of me, clutching a small bird in its mouth. A little kingfisher, trying in vain to get out!</paragraph><paragraph>The fox sits down in front of the crown and refuses to let me near it.</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>March 17th</heading><paragraph>I'm walking down a dark corridor. Somewhere in the distance ahead of me, something shimmers. I don't know what it is, but I feel I must reach it. I'm getting closer. Closer and closer, until I can vaguely make out what I'm looking at...</paragraph><paragraph>The St. Wenceslas' Crown! It's so beautiful. And so close... I could reach it...</paragraph><newpage/><paragraph>I'm not walking, I'm running. I reach out my hand. I can already feel the golden coolness of the crown with my fingertips. But suddenly a fox leaps in front of me, clutching a small bird in its mouth. A little kingfisher, trying in vain to get out!</paragraph><paragraph>The fox sits down in front of the crown and refuses to let me near it.</paragraph><newpage/>
vezninatroskach_scribeboo_dTcL:
<heading>Goodness</heading>
<paragraph>A very special herb. I have not yet been able to prove its positive impact on the human intellect, even in combination with divisna!</paragraph><paragraph>Not surprisingly, though, when I test the effects on myself. Can a mind as spirited as mine be any more strengthened?</paragraph><paragraph>I must quickly find a dullard and try it on him. Fortunately, there are more than enough suitable subjects here in the castle...</paragraph> <newpage/>

<heading>Oregano</heading>
<paragraph>The Greek origin of the name - "joy of the mountain" also provides a clue to the special properties of this herb. I see here an opportunity for a lucrative commercial enterprise, if I can come to a deal with some mine custodian.</paragraph><paragraph>Such a gentleman would surely be very grateful if I could enhance the miners' ability to find ore and thus increase his profits!</paragraph> <newpage/>
vezninatroskach_scribeboo_falU:
My love for you is heartfelt.
You can tell from my unbuckled belt.
My mind is troubled badly
by one question above all:
When will my lover fondly
caress my left ball?
"Love thy neighbour", saith Our Lord.
and I took it to heart.
I started to fulfil His word,
at least in their southern part.
My heart is mourning dejectedly.
Even my hand rejected me!
By day and night I think of you,
I shall love you always.
My heart is faithful, loyal and true,
Though my body sometimes strays.
A knight in battle attire
got into bed with his squire.
Instead of conquering forts,
The played with each other's swords.

vezninatroskach_scribeboo_iviZ:
<heading>No Black</heading>
<paragraph>I may believe in my theory, but there are limits to the courage of even a scientist like me. But perhaps the next generation will confirm that this amazing herb can stop the spread of plague, and even help the infected from unpleasant skin manifestations.</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>Elderberry</heading>
<paragraph>I believe my theory of the efficacy of this plant will one day be proven beyond a doubt, although, unfortunately, it may take many years before the results can be ascertained. Nonetheless, since I use this herb myself daily, I shall almost certainly live to see its beneficial effects on longevity as well as inducing the wisdom of the elders, to which I look forward.</paragraph><newpage/>
vezninatroskach_scribeboo_lVLT:

<paragraph>I hesitate to attempt using this plant, lest it conjure up demons, whether false or real!</paragraph>

vezninatroskach_scribeboo_Pm7V:
<heading>Hemlock</heading>
<paragraph>I have tried to use this strange herb perhaps ten times, but always in vain. Drying, crushing, cooking, decanting, inhaling, oral, surface and rectal use,... In short, nothing works, and I have been unable to find other subjects willing to test it. Even the dumbest chelonians notice when I put something in their food! Oh how hard it is to find someone willing to sacrifice themselves for the glory of alchemy...</paragraph><paragraph>Nothing to be done, I will have to give up my hemlock experiments. In short, no matter how hard I try, I have never been able to cause the flower to rotate in effect. It never seems to cure a headache. It always just causes...</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>Hemlock</heading>
<paragraph>I have tried to use this strange herb perhaps ten times, but always in vain. Drying, grinding, boiling, decanting, inhaling, oral, surface and rectal use,... In short, nothing works, and I have run out of subjects to test it on, due to many undesirable side effects, including death, and even the least attentive hired hand is wary, lest I put something in their food. In fact, the herb seems to induce the total opposite to the desired result, causing trembling of the hands, staggering, panting and nausea, instead of improving agility and stealth ability.</paragraph><paragraph>Alas, I shall have to give up my experiments. In short, even the most dextrous of subjects shows no improvement in lock-picking skills - on the contrary, the herb actually causes... </paragraph><newpage/>
vezninatroskach_scribeboo_Y0C2:
<heading>Swimmer</heading>
<paragraph>Because I have had excellent success with this plant! Its potency perfectly matches the name. It was enough to extract the scent of the flowers and rub the fragrant oil on it, and I was immediately admired by all the maids and cooks. You could almost say that the effects were... Too strong...</paragraph><paragraph>A thinker like me is simply not prepared to perform such physical feats as the intoxication of the pheasant makes available to him... But I don't despair. A bit of darkness, buoyancy, and maybe a devil and a nine-force might help me in my endeavors! I could slip the local cooks some pheasant...</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>Mercurialis</heading>
<paragraph>Nevertheless, I have had promising results with this plant! Its effects are truly mercurial, causing the test subjects to run hither and thither at great speed, although they themselves naively reported that this was due to a sudden pressing urge to defecate and urinate. Running at speed is certainly a useful skill for messengers, although the tendency of the subjects to run away from people rather than towards them is admittedly a disadvantage. However, I do not despair. I still believe the addition of other ingredients, such as bittersweet nightshade, orchis mascula, or perhaps maybe calla and butterbur might reduce the side-effects and allow me to create true messengers of the gods.</paragraph><newpage/>

wedding_contract_2_part_hPn3: <paragraph>Anežka's daughter will bring two long brocades, six embroidered robes, three good winter coats, and two lined summer robes. Three bard's hats and two men's fine rabbit hats. Also linen for three beds, and pillows and comforters of good goose down. Utensils of copper and pewter, two full tables in number, and a mirror of bone very fine. Of jewels, then, two necklaces of river pearls, two brooches of silver, and one inlaid with almandine, called the Marian.</paragraph>

weddingcontract_part_DWlt:
<paragraph>On the part of the unmarried <accent>Drozda</accent>, the marriage of his daughter is to be secured by the yearly proceeds of ten corners of corn or half of that given on anything else, and half a penny from the possession of the hereditary fast. And all this is to pass outright to the children who come of the union.</paragraph>
<paragraph>On the part of Mr. <accent>of Semin</accent>, the covenant is supported by the whole of the property which shall pass to his son Oldrich, except such property as shall be acquired afterwards, or shall fall to the gift for the salvation of the soul of Mr. John of Semin.</paragraph>

<paragraph>Unfortunately, I don't know the bride, so I can't wish her husband well. And if I know the groom too well, I can't congratulate the bride either.

<subtitle>Wedding toast</subtitle>
<paragraph>Unfortunately, I don't know the bride, so I can't congratulate her groom. And knowing the groom too well, neither can I congratulate the bride.</paragraph>
zachranaptacka_rozasbook__aZ87:
<newpage/><subtitle>Thinking is not knowing</subtitle>
<paragraph>A certain Kutnohora grandee once visited an old charlatan and wanted to know his fate. The charlatan examined his palm carefully and said to him, "I see you are the father of two children..." "That's what you think," shook his head. "I am the father of three children!" "That's what you think..." smiled the charlatan. </paragraph>

<newpage/><subtitle>Thinking is Not Knowing</subtitle>
<paragraph>A certain Kuttenberg gentleman once visited an old charlatan and wanted to know his fate. The charlatan examined his palm carefully and said to him, 'I see you are the father of two children...' 'You're mistaken,' he shook his head. 'I am the father of three children!' 'It is you who are mistaken!' smiled the charlatan. </paragraph>
zachranaptacka_rozasbook__Q6FR:
<newpage/><heading>Repent, Adam's family</heading>
<subtitle>A. von Wallenstein and Raimund R. Hardt on men and women</subtitle>
<paragraph>As many, and men in particular, will gladly testify, of the two generations, it is the female that is imperfect, prone to all manner of sins and faults. It is an old known truth that the testimony of many is a credible testimony, the truth of which cannot be doubted. But who hath appointed the woman her lot? God? Or man? Who has decreed that woman is incapable of thinking, acting and deciding without the guidance of man?
<paragraph>By whom was it determined that women were too foolish and vice-ridden to participate in matters wholly male - politics, science, or the liberal arts? Is such a resolution supported by experience or evidence? After all, no one has ever given a woman the opportunity to demonstrate the necessary judgment and wit. We have only conveniently condemned it as inadequate, and have made this judgment an established truth which no one dares to question. </paragraph>
<paragraph>We have witnessed many injuries to the daughters of Eve, and therefore may, or rather must, testify that the world is unjustly ordered in this respect. Men are fond of exalting themselves above women and attributing all sorts of wrongs to them, but only to cover their own faults!</paragraph>
<paragraph>A man who accuses a woman of vice has squandered his own youth in licentiousness. In old age, these men recall with regret the sins of their past life without ever repenting of them. It is out of this bitterness that they denounce women, in order to humiliate and vilify them in the minds of all who are willing to listen to them. These corrupt old men are like incurable leprosy.</paragraph>
<paragraph>But even more than women, men prefer to elevate themselves above other men. For example, they claim that husbands who listen to their wives' advice are fools and deserve ridicule. But we say that a man who has a wife who is sensible and wise, and refuses to listen to her, is twice as foolish!

<newpage/><heading>Repent, Adam's Gender</heading>

zikmunduvtabor_albikpoiso_aaGL: <heading>Sleep</heading><paragraph>This poison will not bring quick death, but its effects may be even more terrible. It soothes a man in a reasonable quantity, and gives him rest, that his body may be speedily healed; but if it be given by a person of dishonest intentions, his victim falls into a sound sleep, in which he feels not his body, and may be treated so unkindly and cruelly. </paragraph><paragraph>A man intoxicated with the concoction of sleep feels faint, his tongue is confused, his head is heavy, and he soon falls asleep. When more than is moderated, however, a man suddenly drinks the decoction, vomits it up, and loses all its effect.</paragraph><paragraph>If you want to relieve people around you with Sleep, prepare for yourself oil, thistle, crow's eye, and especially a handful of poppies, which give the decoction a picturesque smell and a sparkling color, and can overcome the disgust of crow's eye.</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>Lullaby</heading><paragraph>This poison will not bring quick death, but its effects may be even more terrible. It soothes a man in a reasonable quantity, and gives him rest, that his body may be speedily healed, but if it be given by a person of dishonest intentions, his victim falls into a sound sleep, in which he does not feels his body, and may be treated so unkindly and cruelly. If drank oftenly, the healthy spirit then leaves the body.</paragraph><paragraph>A man intoxicated with the Lullaby concoction feels faint, his tongue is confused, his head is heavy, and he soon falls asleep. When more than in moderation, however, a man drinks suddenly, he vomits it up, and it loses all its effect.</paragraph><paragraph>If you want to relieve people around you with Lullaby, prepare for yourself oil, thistle, herb paris and especially a handful of poppies, which give the decoction a vibrant odour and a sparkling color, and can overcome the disgust of herb paris.</paragraph><newpage/>
zikmunduvtabor_albikpoiso_cLBI: <heading>Ed of the pipistrelle</heading><paragraph>This is one of the rarest, for it is obtained only from the feathers and skin of the pipistrelle. This animal, of a black and yellow colour, has its origin far beyond the land of the Indians, and the touch of it causes considerable trouble to man. The killers, therefore, have no need to prepare any decoctions, but only to make headdresses and necklaces of the feathers for their victims.</paragraph><paragraph>Those who come into contact with the feathers of the plover often feel a tingling and tension in their muscles. This condition can persist for days, giving the mordant the time it needs to escape. In such cases, it is enough to burn the feathers and the poisoning will pass. If, however, the unfortunate ingests the essence of the feathers prepared by a long boil, expect more serious consequences. As a plank, the victim first stiffens and soon dies, unless a drink of sea-water and crushed stone from the mountains of Monti Pallidi, which thou shalt find in the land of Wallachia, be prepared in time.</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>Pitohui Bird Poison</heading><paragraph>This is one of the rarest, for it is obtained only from the feathers and skin of the Pitohui. This creature, of a black and yellow colour, has its origin far beyond the land of the Indians, and the touch of it causes considerable trouble to man. The killers, therefore, have no need to prepare any decoctions, but only to make headdresses and necklaces of the feathers for their victims.</paragraph><paragraph>Those who come into contact with the feathers of the Pitohui often feel a tingling and tension in their muscles. This condition can persist for days, giving the murderer the time he needs to escape. In such cases, it is enough to burn the feathers and the poisoning will pass. If, however, the unfortunate ingests the essence of the feathers prepared by a long boil, expect more serious consequences. The victim first stiffens and soon dies, unless a drink of sea-water and crushed stone from the mountains of Monti Pallidi, which thou shalt find in the Italian land, be prepared in time.</paragraph><newpage/>

<title>The Book of Poison</title><subtitle>about abominable poisons and their remedies</subtitle><newpage/>
zikmunduvtabor_albikpoiso_Ogwn: <heading>Death's Kiss</heading><paragraph> Although difficult to prepare, this potion is often used because its pleasant aroma can be confused with ordinary cooking. It is also said among the poor that this mixture can be used to turn metals into gold.</paragraph><paragraph>The death kiss will first cause a stomachache. It makes the skin red and blistered, the bowels painfully empty at both ends, the ouds stiffen in spasm, and the nails break. And then thou shalt know that death is certain, but before that thou mayest relieve the poor man with a bezoar put under the tongue. A mixture of hot milk, vinegar, and garlic can be used to reverse the poison.</paragraph><paragraph>If you want to make this poison, take a new clay pot, put a handful of red copper, half a bottle of strong water, arsenic, oak bark, and rose water inside. And boil it all, and test it with an iron nail. When the muddy mixture has completely coated the iron, you will know that you have cooked enough.</paragraph><newpage/>

<heading>Kiss of Death</heading><paragraph> Although difficult to prepare, this potion is often used because its pleasant aroma can be confused with ordinary cooking. It is also said among the poor that this mixture can be used to turn metals into gold.</paragraph><paragraph>The Kiss of Death will first cause a stomachache. It makes the skin red and blistered, the bowels painfully empty at both ends, the udders stiffen in spasm, and the nails break. And then thou shalt know that death is certain, but before that thou mayest relieve the poor man with a bezoar put under the tongue. In quick reaction, a mixture of hot milk, vinegar, and garlic can also be used to cause the poison to be thrown up.</paragraph><paragraph>If you want to make this poison, take a new clay pot, put a handful of red copper, half a bottle of strong water, arsenic, oak bark, and rose water inside. Boil it all, and test it with an iron nail. When the muddy mixture has completely coated the iron, you will know that you have cooked enough.</paragraph><newpage/>
zikmunduvtabor_albikpoiso_Uw2q: <heading>Paralysis</heading><paragraph>This potion is especially useful because it soothes and relieves pain. It is therefore a favourite among the columnists. If you rub even a few drops on the skin of a wounded man, you can cut him without causing him suffering. Men in love, too, who are hasty in their love, rub their manhood with this potion, so that it may become numb and they may please their wives.</paragraph><paragraph>A fool who tastes even a sip of the paralysis will experience total numbness, his intestines will become clogged, and he may lose his sight for a while. Fortunately, the stomach will reverse this disgusting potion before it has time to have its pernicious effect, unless the body has already been weakened.</paragraph><paragraph>If you need to replenish your supply of this decoction, prepare for yourself a strong liquor, a handful of valerian and twice as much crow's eye. Remember, however, not to boil the valerian in the liquor, but only to put the crushed valerian into the cold decoction!

<heading>Dollmaker Potion</heading><paragraph>This potion is especially useful because it soothes and relieves pain. It is therefore a favourite among the physicians. If you rub even a few drops on the skin of a wounded man, you can cut him without causing him suffering. Men who are hasty in their love rub their manhood with this potion too, so that it may become numb and they may manage to please their wives.</paragraph><paragraph>A fool who tastes even a sip of the potion will experience total numbness, his intestines will become clogged, and he may lose his sight for a while. Fortunately, the stomach will eject this disgusting potion before it has time to have its pernicious effect, unless the body has already been weakened.</paragraph><paragraph>If you need to replenish your supply of this decoction, prepare yourself a strong liquor, a handful of valerian and twice as much herb paris. Remember, however, not to boil the valerian in the liquor, but only to put the crushed valerian into the cold decoction!</paragraph><newpage/>
zikmunduvtabor_albikpoiso_Z8vX: <heading>Destruction</heading><paragraph>A particularly evil poison, which causes certain death even in small quantities. It is widespread especially in Bohemia and Austria, because the plants necessary for its preparation are everywhere plentiful. Do not expect much benefit from the knowledge of this poison, for it can be used for nothing but killing.</paragraph><paragraph>When an unfortunate man who has swallowed the poison comes to you for advice, give glory to God, for it is a miracle that he is still alive. For a little while thou mayest observe in him the blackness of the eyes, the dryness of the body, or the looseness of the muscles; but then send for the priest at once. Even a few drops will cause certain death, and there is no guaranteed antidote in the whole wide world.</paragraph><paragraph>If you have to cook this crap, prepare yourself some wine, a handful of wormwood, and twice as much rouille. Then you shall finish the evil work with toadstool. Boil the mixture until you have a clear liquid, almost imperceptible in taste and smell.

<heading>Bane</heading><paragraph>A particularly evil potion, which causes certain death even in small quantities. It is widespread especially in Bohemia and Austria, because the plants necessary for its preparation are everywhere plentiful. Do not expect much benefit from the knowledge of this poison, for it can be used for nothing but killing.</paragraph><paragraph>When an unfortunate man who has swallowed this poison comes to you for advice, give glory to God, for it is a miracle that he is still alive. For a little while thou mayest observe in him the blackness of the eyes, the dryness of the body, or the looseness of the muscles, but then send for the priest at once. Even a few drops will cause certain death, and there is no guaranteed antidote in the whole wide world.</paragraph><paragraph>If you have to cook this abomination, prepare yourself some wine, a handful of wormwood and twice as much belladonna. Then you shall finish the evil work with Fly agaric. Boil the mixture until you have a clear liquid, almost imperceptible in taste and smell.</paragraph><newpage/>
zikmunduvtabor_cherthanio_8LGC: <paragraph>The most honourable man and commander of the military camp at Kutná Hora, the noble lord Grozav of Borumlaca, hereby confirms by this letter that he has received the sum of six kopecks from cuman Cherthan, and is therefore obliged to pay his debt duly.</paragraph><paragraph>The noble lord of Borumlaca further promises that he will not use any goods or cattle to repay his debt, in return for which cuman Cherthan has promised not to sell the note and not to mention its existence.</paragraph>

<paragraph>The most honourable man and commander of the military camp by Kuttenberg, the noble lord Grozav of Borumlaca, hereby confirms by this letter that he has received the sum of six threescores from the cuman Chertan, and is therefore obliged to pay his debt duly.</paragraph><paragraph>The noble lord of Borumlaca further promises that he will not use any goods or cattle to repay his debt, in return for which the cuman Chertan has promised not to sell the note and not to mention its existence.</paragraph>
zik_part_M7Rx:
Brave Sir Markvart of Úlice, Commander of the Prague militia and dear friend.

I have received news of your injury and the progress of the siege of Suchdol fortress, therefore I address you with this letter not as your sovereign, but as a friend.Once your health permits travel, leave the Praguers to handle that cursed fortress as best they can and join me in Hungary. I need you by my side as an advisor and on the Hungarian field as a commander.

I pray for your recovery and our early reunion.

zizkaletter_fromsokolneba_fveV: <paragraph>My dear friend, unfortunately we will not meet as planned because the recent events in the Kingdom of Hungary have forced me to stay in Moravia. Of course, I cannot entrust more details to letters, but I am sure you will understand what I mean when I say the hunters are already gathering and the fox hunt will soon begin.</paragraph><paragraph>Along with the letter, I send you my shield, as there is no need to hide anymore, but rather to openly show what side are we on. May my coat of arms with a goat head bring you good luck and protect you in your righteous fight. God bless you!</paragraph><paragraph>John Sokol of Lamberg bearing a coat of arms with a goat head</paragraph>

<paragraph>My dear friend, unfortunately we will not meet as planned because the recent events in the Kingdom of Hungary have forced me to stay in Moravia. Of course, I cannot entrust more details to letters, but I am sure you will understand what I mean when I say the hunters are already gathering and the fox hunt will soon begin.</paragraph><paragraph>Along with the letter, I send you my shield, as there is no need to hide anymore, but rather to openly show what side are we on. May my coat of arms with a goat head bring you good luck and protect you in your righteous fight. God bless you!</paragraph><paragraph>Jan Sokol of Lamberg bearing a coat of arms with a goat head</paragraph>

He himself had to admit that, whoever his royal cousin Wenceslas might be, a country without a king benefits only leeches like von Bergow or von Rosenberg.</paragraph><paragraph>Therefore I urge you to go to Trosky, recruit more men for our cause there, and, above all, force Otto von Bergow to withdraw from Prague. I know you will not let me down. I know you, when you start something, you finish it. I hope to see you soon. God bless you!</paragraph>
